{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3526663,"name":"","username":"JaxsonSP","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/48db29/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T01:47:50.686Z","cooked":"

We are having some connection issues with our new VH-109 radio. I am able to connect to the network, deploy code via robotpy deploy, and access the roborio with ssh. However when trying to test code the driver station gives me the following error.

I have updated the radio firmware to 1.2.9, updated frc game tools to 2025 and the roborio2 to 2025 as well. I can connect to the wifi but it says: “No internet, secured”. Because we only have one radio we are using 2.4GHz if that matters. Sorry if this is an obvious fix (or in the wrong section) we are a pretty new team.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T01:47:50.686Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":92,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":485.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491636,"topic_slug":"vh-109-connection-issues","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://preview.redd.it/vh-109-connection-issues-v0-mnah09drlyie1.png?width=518&format=png&auto=webp&s=03082b297978b0280334e65d13a9e536559e732f","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73437,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-connection-issues/491636/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3526673,"name":"Fletcher","username":"FletcherS7","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletchers7/{size}/168995_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T01:59:16.095Z","cooked":"
JaxsonSP:

DS radio(.4)-bad and FMS-bad are to be expected when not connected to the field at an event.

JaxsonSP:

I can connect to the wifi but it says: “No internet, secured”.

This is expected since the robot is not connected to the internet.

If you are able to access the roboRIO via SSH then it’s unlikely this is a problem with the VH-109.

JaxsonSP:

However when trying to test code the driver station gives me the following error.

What exactly are you trying to test?
Do you have the same behavior when connected with tethered?

Thanks for your help, Just tested and when connected via ethernet to the radio or roborio the error persists. As for what we are trying to test we are trying to run code that I was able to be deploy, however we dont have robot communication:

image(1)1529×338 99.3 KB

Looks like the Windows Firewall is still enabled.
Try disabling all three and then restart the Driver Station software.
